org.instantplaces.purewidgets.client.widgets
Interface GuiWidgetInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGuiWidget, GuiButton
public interface GuiWidgetInterface

Interface that all widgets must implement. A widget has a widgetID that identifies the widget in the application (so it must be a unique id within the application) and possibly several optionIDs that correspond to items of the widget that can be separately selected by the user. A widget has always at least one optionID. OptionIDs can be changed in run time by adding or removing them from the widget. These changes should be made visible to the user so that it can correctly choose among the existing options. Each optionID will be assigned a reference code by the interaction manager. Reference codes are the human-readable references used by users to select an option or a widget for input. When the set of reference codes assigned to a widget changes (because the widget added or removed optionIDs) the InteractionManager will notify the widget by calling onReferenceCodesUpdated() (it is necessary to use an asynchronous mechanism because reference codes are assigned by the Instant Places server and so may take some time to update). Widgets can have (and usually will) ActionListeners attached. An application registers an ActionListener so that it will be notified of any input directed at that widget. The widget will only notify its ActionListeners if it is input enabled. Widgets can be configured to disable input automatically for a specified period of time after receiving an input. This may important for widgets that toggle their state because, otherwise, their behaviour might seem erratic from the users point of view if several simultaneous input were received. If this setting is enabled, only one input will affect the widget state (and be communicated to the application). Input will be re-enabled after a specified number of seconds have elapsed.

Author:
Jorge C. S. Cardoso

Method Detail

setInputEnabled

void setInputEnabled(boolean inputEnabled)
Enables or disables this Widget's processing of InputEvents. If disabled, the Widget will no longer fire ActionEvents.

Parameters:
inputEnabled -

isInputEnabled

boolean isInputEnabled()
Returns:
True if the widget is input enabled; false otherwise.

setEnabled

void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Sets the visual feedback of the widget to enabled or disabled. This settings affects only the visual state. The widget may still receive input even if its visual state indicates otherwise.

Parameters:
enabled -

isEnabled

Returns the visual state of the widget.
